importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication reflects the most recent update on the incident involving Doug Martin's death, indicating public awareness and ongoing public discourse around police interactions and civilian safety.
The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection highlights his early career success and establishes his prominence in American sports, contributing to his public profile.
The year Martin achieved first-team All-Pro status and Pro Bowl selection underscores key milestones in his athletic career, reinforcing his status as a top-tier NFL player.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This time frame captures Martin’s peak NFL performance, during which he earned major accolades, contributing to his cultural and national visibility.
This time frame covers the incident of his arrest and death, placing it in the context of current public debates about police conduct and use of force.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during an investigation into a home break-in in Oakland.

Martin was a 31st overall draft pick in 2012 and had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including multiple Pro Bowl selections and recognition as one of the top 50 players in franchise history.
He was 36 years old at the time of death; the cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest; no further details were released.
Martin’s family requested privacy during their time of grief, and city leaders, including Mayor Barbara Lee, expressed condolences.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers publicly mourned his death, acknowledging his impact on the franchise.
This incident has sparked renewed public discussion about police interactions with civilians, especially those with a history of public visibility and national fame.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland Police Department officers during an investigation into a home break-in. The incident has sparked public discussion about law enforcement practices and the safety of individuals, especially those with high public profiles. Martin was a first-round draft pick in 2012 and earned multiple Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors, with recognition as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history. While the cause of death remains undetermined, the Oakland Police Department confirmed a 'brief struggle' during the arrest; the Alameda County Coroner’s Office will conduct an autopsy. The incident has prompted outreaches from local officials, including Mayor Barbara Lee, and public mourning from the Buccaneers organization, underscoring the broader societal implications of police-citizen encounters.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention in Oakland
